text: Zdena Tominová (7 February 1941 – 24 May 2020) was a Czech novelist and a dissident in the communist era of Czechoslovakia. He was born in Prague. She was a spokesperson for Charter 77. Tominová published two novels in the 1980s, Stalin's Shoe and The Coast of Bohemia. Tominová died on 24 May 2020 in Prague, aged 79. ==References== Category:Czech novelists Category:Political writers Category:Writers from Prague Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths
title: Zdena Tominová
